rules: Rule1: Provided that security verified form 1, then if the employee submitted form 1, it follows that either the employee is approved by the director, or the employee is approved by the supervisor, or the employee is approved by the manager.
Rule2: Either the guard checks the vehicle or the agent checks the vehicle.
Rule3: Whenever the agent checks the vehicle, then if the employee does not have a valid clearance, it is not the case that the employee is authorized to enter the building.
Rule4: Provided that the guard issues a pass to the employee, then the guard grants access to the employee.
Rule5: Either the guard issues a pass to the employee or the agent issues a pass to the employee.

Rule6: Under the condition that the agent issues a pass to the employee, then if the inspector documented the check of the vehicle, then if the guard checks the vehicle, then if the employee does not have a valid clearance, the employee is not authorized to enter the building.
Rule7: If the employee has training in the protocol, then the employee does not have access to the lab.
Rule8: If the employee has valid authorization, then if it is not the case that having the manual publication implies valid clearance, then the employee requires training.

Rule10: Either the employee scans the device or security scans the device.

Rule12: Under the condition that the employee uses tool 1, then if the employee does not have a valid clearance, the employee enters the restricted area.
Rule13: Whenever the employee uses tool 2, then if the employee does not have a valid clearance, the employee enters the restricted area.
Rule14: If the employee operates the electronic device, then the employee uses tool 1.
Rule15: Provided that the employee operates the handheld device, then the employee uses tool 2.
Rule16: If the employee has clearance at level 1, then the employee has training in the protocol.
Rule17: Whenever the employee completes the course, then the employee receives a certificate.
Rule18: Either the employee completes the course, or the employee operates the electronic device, or the employee operates the handheld device.
Rule19: Under the condition that HR reviews the file of the employee, then if it is not the case that having the manual publication implies valid clearance, then the employee requires training.
Rule20: Provided that the admin processes the application of the employee, then if HR denies access for the employee, then HR approves access for the employee.
Rule21: Whenever the guard verifies the identity of the employee, then the employee has valid authorization.
Rule22: Either the guard verifies the identity of the employee or security verifies the identity of the employee.
Rule23: Provided that security verifies the identity of the employee, then security confirms the clearance of the employee.
Rule24: If security confirms the clearance of the employee, then the supervisor confirms the clearance of the employee.
Rule25: Whenever the supervisor confirms the clearance of the employee, then the employee has valid authorization.
Rule26: If the employee uses the scanner, then if the employee does not have a valid clearance, the employee has clearance at level 1.
Rule27: Provided that the employee submits a report, then the system logs the activity of the employee.
Rule28: Either the employee submits a report or the supervisor submits a report.
Rule29: If the supervisor submits a report, then the employee does not complete the course.
Rule30: If the system logs the activity of the employee, then the system triggers an investigation into the incident.
Rule31: Whenever the database updates the record of the employee, then the employee does not complete the course.
Rule32: Provided that the system generates an alert for security, then the database updates the record of the employee.
Rule33: Under the condition that the system triggers an investigation into the incident, then the supervisor escalates the case of the employee.
Rule34: If the employee carries the mobile device, then if the employee does not have a valid clearance, the employee enters the restricted area.
Rule35: Provided that the employee carries the tablet, then if the employee does not have a valid clearance, the employee enters the restricted area.
Rule36: Under the condition that the employee uses the terminal, then if the employee does not have a valid clearance, the employee has clearance at level 1.
Rule37: If the employee registers the device, then either the employee carries the mobile device or the employee carries the tablet.
Rule38: Either the employee registers the device or security registers the device.
Rule39: Whenever security registers the device, then either the employee carries the mobile device or the employee carries the tablet.
Rule40: If the investigator initiates a probe into the incident, then the investigator conducts an interview with the employee.

Rule41: Under the condition that the investigator conducts an interview with the employee, then if it is not the case that lacking a valid clearance implies the employee enters the restricted area, then the employee does not report the loss of the device.
Rule42: Either the employee violates the policy, or the employee uses tool 1, or the employee uses tool 2.
Rule43: Whenever security monitors the system network, then the system detects an anomaly in the activity.
Rule44: Whenever the system flags a violation by the employee, then the employee does not violate the policy.
Rule45: Provided that the employee violates the procedure, then the employee follows the procedure.
Rule46: If the employee violates the procedure, then the employee does not follow the procedure.
Rule47: Under the condition that the employee is approved by the supervisor, then the employee has a valid clearance.
Rule48: Whenever the employee is approved by the manager, then the employee has a valid clearance.
Rule49: Provided that it is not the case that the employee uses the scanner or the employee uses the terminal, then the employee violates the procedure.

Rule50: Under the condition that it is not the case that if the supervisor escalates the case of the employee then the system generates an alert for security, then the supervisor closes the case of the employee.
Rule51: If it is not the case that if the supervisor escalates the case of the employee then the system generates an alert for security, then the supervisor does not close the case of the employee.

Rule52: Whenever it is not the case that security issues a warning to the employee or if the system detects an anomaly in the activity then the system flags a violation by the employee, then security suspends access for the employee.
Rule53: Provided that it is not the case that lacking a valid clearance implies the employee enters the restricted area, then the employee reports the loss of the device.

Rule55: Provided that HR does not review the file of the employee, then it is not the case that HR approves access for the employee.

Rule58: Whenever the employee does not have a valid clearance, then the employee does not enter the restricted area.
facts: Fact3: The inspector documented the check of the vehicle.
Fact4: The employee has the manual publication.
Fact5: The admin processes the application of the employee.
Fact6: The investigator initiates a probe into the incident.
Fact7: Security monitors the system network.
Fact8: It is not the case that the employee is approved by the director.
Fact9: The guard does not grant access to the employee.
Fact10: The employee does not require training.
Fact11: The employee does not receive a certificate.
Fact12: Security does not issue a warning to the employee.
Fact13: Security does not suspend access for the employee.

question: The employee has a valid clearance.
